results.title: Origin of land plants: liverworts and mosses
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 2. Plant life”.
Traces the evolution of land plants and illustrates the structural characteristics, reproductive processes and adaptive mechanisms of liverworts and mosses. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: What's in a rainbow?: making scientific models
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”.
Shows how to create a scientific model of a rainbow using a hose, stressing that the angle of the sun in the sky is an important factor in determining whether or not a rainbow appears. Introduces the ideas of reflection and refraction. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Water runs downhill: observation and inference
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath, Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”.
A number of observations concerning water are made, and from these inferences are drawn about water and gravity and the part they play in eroding and shaping the earth. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Seeds and weeds: observing plants
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”

Points out various types of weeds and notes their effective methods of seed dispersal in terms of the particular environments in which they can survive. Introduces the process of germination and the importance of sunlight for growth.

results.title: Machines, engines and motors
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”.
Provides examples of simple machines such as levers, wheel and axle machines, pulleys, wedges and inclined planes. Also gives definitions of machines, motors, engines and energy. Suitable for upper primary level.

group_works.title: Mao: long march to power
group_works.creator_credit: Don Thompson, Pat Ferns, Sam Summerlin, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns

group_works.title: Mao: organised chaos
group_works.creator_credit: Don Thompson, Pat Ferns, Sam Summerlin, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns

results.title: Mao: organised chaos
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, Pat Ferns, Sam Summerlin, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Leaders of the twentieth century: portraits of power”.
Second in a two part film on Mao Tse-tung. Looks at Mao and his regime from the proclamation of the People’s Republic of China on 1st October 1949, to his death in 1976. Follows the cultural revolution; the elimination of Mao’s enemies; Mao’s visit to Moscow; the Korean War; Chiang’s regime; and Nixon’s visit to China. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Thompson, Pat Ferns, Sam Summerlin, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns

group.title: Leaders of the twentieth century: portraits of power

group_siblings.title: Mao: long march to power

results.title: Mao: long march to power
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, Pat Ferns, Sam Summerlin, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Leaders of the twentieth century: portraits of power”.
First in a two part film on Mao Tse-tung. His beginnings as a peasant farmer through to his rise to power in the 1949 revolution are highlighted in this film. Attention is also given to Sun Yat Sen’s nationalists: Chiang Kai-shek and Mao’s Communist Party of 1921. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary levels.
